website_summaries.verdict: Doesn't offer the convenience of battery operation, but it delivers a lot of torque.
pros: With an electrical cord operation, it delivers just a bit more power than most battery-powered Makita impact drivers
Lightweight because it doesn't include a heavy battery
Should give you a long-lasting performance
With this unit, you never have to worry about running out of power while in the middle of a job
cons: Not as convenient to use in out-of-the-way locations as a battery-powered device

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite tools
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite tools in the workshop. It does what it's supposed to do quickly and with no fuss. Its incredibly comfortable and well balanced in my hand. Expensive but worth it...no dead batteries when I need to drive big screws, and wont quit in the middle of a job.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: If you need to drive a lot of screws, life for screwing down composite decking, or for drywall, or structural screws, well then that cordless impact just wont drive them.... and then this guy is a must! It is very well made.... still made in Japan, and is well balanced and rugged. I have another one that has lasted for years. It also comes with a hard case for easy storage as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jv

customer_reviews.title: Drive scews like the Pro's.
customer_reviews.text: This driver works like a dream. If you want to drive 3 inch deck screws like the professionals you need this driver. I got this because it's corded. Was tired of batteries going dead. Be sure to buy hex head or star drive screws. Phillips screws suck. Only drawback is the price. Expensive but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: combothe9

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Strong + no Batteries
customer_reviews.text: I have not tried other corded impact drivers, so consider that when you read this. My other impact drivers are an air wrench, two Ridgid Jobmaxes, and a fantastic Panasonic 12-volt cordless. This machine is a lot stronger, and of course, it never needs recharging or EXPENSIVE EXPENSIVE EXPENSIVE batteries. It will rip long 1/4" screws out of a workbench so fast it's scary. The cord is nice and long, and I like the hook. This is a great tool to have, for those times when your cordless tools are too wimpy and you don't feel like firing up the compressor.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Caballero

customer_reviews.title: Faster than waiting for batteries to charge
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one for putting down decking, now we've got three going on our crew. No down time no chargers,, run the cords right and the day goes faster
customer_reviews.author: Carpenter333

customer_reviews.title: Decent but keep an eye on it
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a deck project. Ended up removing and driving over 2,000 3” screws. The drill got extremely hot and eventually started leaking oil from the chuck area. Was happy with the drills performance but concerned it wouldn’t hold up with it leaking oil. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Billy from Philly

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy. I've also had no problems driving 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this drill for a few years now. I should have bought this long ago. Drove hundreds of deck screws into my new 200 sq ft wood deck with no problem. Mark the locations, drill pilot holes to keep the deck board from splitting, and drive the screw. Easy peasy. I've also had no problems driving 3 inch screws into pressure treated lumber - a nearly impossible task for the drill I had been using.
customer_reviews.author: Gehae

customer_reviews.title: A Small Unit that Works Well
customer_reviews.text: This 1/4" drill/driver does not use a battery but plugs in. I find that I do not use a portable drill enough to get any value from expensive batteries that always die within a few years. This unit is compact and easy to use. It has plenty of power and the impact driver function really helps get or keep things moving. Despite the power, I found I could easily control the speed to drill in wood screws. I suggest buying the 1/4" chuck to be able to use standard bits. I expect to hand this tool down to my Son after many years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Jayjock

customer_reviews.title: the real deal. Prior to this, I had ...
customer_reviews.text: the real deal. Prior to this, I had used my Hitachi cordless drill for nearly everything, but this is clearly a step up--of course this is an apples-2-oranges comparison. the Mak has plenty of torque for driving those long screws, and balances quite well in the hand. For me, in my shop, it is more convenient to remove the wire belt hanger.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mount

customer_reviews.title: Your battery powered impact driver is a TOY.
customer_reviews.text: This thing sends screws down like they were hit by meteor strikes. Every other impact driver I own, including the M20V-MAX-XRP-XL-ZY stuff, is a toy compared to this. I suspect that if I provided it with a slightly higher voltage it might just finish my deck on its own. It is truly a fantastic impact fastener, and I wish I'd bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Alex M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: One of the few corded impact drivers I could find - and it's great. I just put up fencing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lance B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Excellent build quality Nicely balanced Not made in China Rugged case Corded Corded is the only way to go in power tools. More power, consistent power, no charging batteries, no costly battery replacements. It's a shame that they are becoming the exception owing to the recurring profits to be had in selling batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: One of the top three tool purchases I have ever made,
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking at this you probably need it and won't regret it. This does one thing and does it very well. This will sink any diameter fastener as deep as you want in the toughest material without stripping the head. Buy this for driving screws and bolts and a dedicated drill for making holes and forget about compromise drill/drivers. The right tool for the job rather than a compromise.
customer_reviews.author: rbiser

customer_reviews.title: Drives Very Well
customer_reviews.text: If you're used to using a cordless impact driver...watch out. This thing is well built and awesome! It makes short work of driving 4" screws into wood. It makes short work of everything else too. Really nice if you know you are going to be doing a lot of repetitive work with an impact driver.
customer_reviews.author: ADG

customer_reviews.title: Great corded impact
customer_reviews.text: High quality, no recurring cost of batteries, and runs cool and quiet. No idea if it's more powerful than a battery powered unit, and yes, you do need to plug it in. But no batteries to worry about. I think this will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: JMH

customer_reviews.title: 5" thick fine with no splitting or bogging down
customer_reviews.text: Compact and powerful. Ran 5" SPAX screws into a yellow pine beam 4.5" thick fine with no splitting or bogging down. Well worth the cost with no batteries to keep swapping out.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Another great deal and tool, I expected good and I got great, very durable, very strong, very pleased, if you're doing drywall to decks this is the best tool to use, I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: frankye fletcher

customer_reviews.title: The best tool for the job!
customer_reviews.text: I have two cordless impact drivers and they are very handy but even with multiple batteries for each, I run out of power in a short time when driving a lot of screws. The plug in Makita impact driver is fantastic for driving screws all day long. I should have bought it before buying my second cordless and the extra batteries for it. Probably cost about the same. And two of my 4 batteries need replacing after one year. The Makita 6952 will drive any screw I have needed to put in so far. Very highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: JagLite

customer_reviews.title: Super duper Love it
customer_reviews.text: Super duper Love it, I save a lot using this baby instead of the battery ones, Plus light nice to use, I recommend it
customer_reviews.author: ruben gatto

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite tools to use
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite tools to use! I have used it for everything from fencing to decking to garage shelving! It is one tough tool that gets the job done. For how much I have used it, it is well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: This a is a very well made refined Tool
customer_reviews.text: Line operated Impact Drivers are hard to find now, this is a well made balanced tool that is a real pleasure to use.
customer_reviews.author: TimH

customer_reviews.title: I got this in addition to the cordless driver that ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this in addition to the cordless driver that I have because I can use it for hours without having to stop to recharge. The torque is far in excess of what is typically required.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hooper

customer_reviews.title: No More batteries
customer_reviews.text: Tired of buying batteries, came across this searching online for a corded impact driver. Decided to purchase and yes I am glad I did. Powerful, to much so for fragile products , but great for driving 3" screws all day. I actually drove a 3" deck screw all the way through a two by two with my first use of this tool. Had to learn to back off LOL Good size, well balanced, not to heavy. I would recommend this to anyone that is tired of buying batteries all the time and wants a good and powerful impact driver that you can work with all day.
customer_reviews.author: RDW

customer_reviews.title: Never deal with dead driver batteries again.
customer_reviews.text: I am a homeowner (not a professional), so my needs were: 1) Work reliably 2) Dont cause battery drama. This driver did both. I have had it for 2 months, and it is powerful and light. I wish it had holders for bits, but oh well.
customer_reviews.author: K R

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful tool. Not for amateurs!
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful tool. Decided to buy this one instead of cordless because I will use only occasionally and would lose batteries. I was amazed at the difference in power to the cordless ones.
customer_reviews.author: Peter R. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC TOOL - drives 9 inch screws into 6" pressure treated lumber like a hot knife through butter
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this instead of having to deal with recharging batteries with my impact wrench; where I use to need eight batteries in a single day driving 9 inch screws into 6" pressure treated timbers while making raised beds, this tool just keeps on driving screws all day long without a single hiccup. Lightweight, well balanced, great grip, classic Makita storage case, belt clip with an easy-to-coil power cord - QUALITY product throughout.
customer_reviews.author: Eldon W Bingham

customer_reviews.title: No batteries to worry about and replace over time
customer_reviews.text: Excellent impact hammer. I don't need a hammer gun that often that I need a battery unit. I can run a cord for my projects and I don't have to worry about replacing expensive batteries.
customer_reviews.author: C. Conkey

customer_reviews.title: Good overall
customer_reviews.text: Really nice piece would have been better with a light
customer_reviews.author: King Ed ruler of nothing

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Nice to have a corded one. I am so done with batteries
customer_reviews.text: I have always been happy with Makita power hand tools and this one is no exception. Unfortunately it is one of the rare corded drivers on the market. I work in cooler climates, so batteries do not last too long. This is a lifesaver.
customer_reviews.author: Sean F

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I never review but this thing is awesome. Better than any dewalt or Milwaukee battery. It drives all day long
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: it is worth the extra money. this thing drives anything you want it to drive.
customer_reviews.author: Margarita

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: Used for a deck with 3" screws. Would have taken 10 or more recharges . Love it
customer_reviews.author: idiotype

customer_reviews.title: great driver made in Japan
customer_reviews.text: this seems a quality product made in Japan. I have considered a cordless version but since I only need this occasionally I don't want to maintain batteries so this would be good choice that will last life time i hope. the speed control is excellent, u can make it go very slow easily. the speed control is NOT linear and it gives u lots of control at lower speed
customer_reviews.author: Michael Deng

customer_reviews.title: I've used it a lot since recweiving it and it works great. Recommend it to anyone who needs or want ...
customer_reviews.text: The only corded drill of this kind that I could find. I've used it a lot since recweiving it and it works great. Recommend it to anyone who needs or want a corded impact drill.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Warren

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. however I am not a pro and only use it infrequently ...
customer_reviews.author: KA

customer_reviews.title: Its About Time!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been searching and waiting for quite a while and finally found a tool manufacturer that isn't totally conned by the battery revolution. I expect this impact driver will be my Best Buddy going into the future,(Second Place,Dogs are in First).I've used this tool several times now and love its performance,but mostly the fact there are no batteries to slow the job down..Thanks Makita..
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: GOOD TOOL
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected to. In my construction business we need to have tools that work for what they are designed for. If you are looking to purchase a corded 1/4" impact driver this is the one to buy.
customer_reviews.author: STC Construction

customer_reviews.title: Great Impact Driver
customer_reviews.text: I use these professionally in building construction, drives Tek screws in steel all day, drives lag screws in timber better. Will eventually overheat. I bought two here because according to the local store it's being discontinued?! I hope there is a comparable corded replacement coming, the extra costs for cordless aren't worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: naivejoe

customer_reviews.title: You will not be disappointed. I am done with stupid battery
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality tool. Expensive, but made in Japan. You will not be disappointed. I am done with stupid battery tools
customer_reviews.author: Hepaticus

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight powerhouse!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made in Japan corded impact driver! Well balanced(T handle) and light weight! Better low speed control than the 14.4 volt cordless 6932 impact driver I also own! Great for workin on my deck that has a outside outlet on wall on corner of deck! Pricey but NO BATTERIES REQUIRED!
customer_reviews.author: tool collector

customer_reviews.title: This makes driving tapcon screws like a party
customer_reviews.text: Simply great light weight and is easy to store while working on ladders or on a work belt. This thing can hold its own with and screw driving device out there.
customer_reviews.author: Franklyn Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great impact driver!
customer_reviews.text: This does everything it suppose to do and no batteries to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: Rick N.

customer_reviews.title: BEST LIGHTWEIGHT GUN ON THE MARKET
customer_reviews.text: I USE THIS TOOL ON DOORS AND OPERATERS IN MY BUSINESS. THE WEIGHT IS PERFECT AND THE POWER IS NOT TO MUCH FOR SHEET METAL BUT ENOUGH FOR TEK SCREWS. MUCH BETTER THAN ANY OTHER WE"VE TRIED IN THE LAST THIRTY YEARS. BETTER YET, YOU DO NOT HAVE TO BUY BATTERIES OR WORRY ABOUT A CHARGE
customer_reviews.author: bruce joy

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: This tool has exceeded my expectations. Even with a light gauge extension cord attached it is much lighter than the Dewalt 18volt cordless model it replaced. It has lots of torque. The only downside is how many driver bits I go through. The impact ready bits hold up better. This tool is hands down the best way to drive deck screws. I can't believe Makita is the only manufacturer of this type of tool.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hachmann

customer_reviews.title: Very well built !
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded my expectations. Very well built and strong. Will screw a 1-1/2 inch lag all day long into old hard wood no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: I've usually have good luck with Makita Tools
customer_reviews.text: I've usually have good luck with Makita Tools, but not this one. The driver didn't run a lot of the time, which was very frustrating on the job site. we stopped using it and had to go back to our back up driver which this was supposed to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Greenberg

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool!
customer_reviews.text: My husband couldn't have been happier with this Birthday gift! Great product for the working man in any house.
customer_reviews.author: 'Cece' Welch

customer_reviews.title: No battery needed
customer_reviews.text: This little impact driver is lightweight, easy to use and requires NO BATTERIES. It is small enough to fit in tight places and strong enough to put a screw into just about anything I have come up with. Also the tool belt hook is a great feature. I personally hate dealing with batteries and replacements are over priced so if you can deal with a cord and maybe an extension cord then this impact driver is worth every penny. So when the other guys run out of juice and have to go recharge the batteries you can keep working and get your projects finished.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Makita Impact Driver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this along with a cordless impact driver. It isn't as versatile as the cordles tool but it will drive 3 inch decking screws very easily. It will even drive the #2 phillips head screws, just make sure you have plenty of driver bits. I like the tool, and the Makita brand so I will give it a five star.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: It is a beast of a screw driving machine
customer_reviews.text: It is very fast in setting deck screws and the driver bit never jumps and no more stripped screw heads. It works so fast that at times it seems to be shooting deck screw into the lumber.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Bathroom Remodel Tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband's and my birthday because it is a little pricey, but we were gutting our bathroom and redoing it so I felt justified. It is the best compact driver EVER! Couldn't have done it without!
customer_reviews.author: Do-It-Yourselfers

customer_reviews.title: Its a great tool to have
customer_reviews.text: This guy is a workhorse! Its a great tool to have. Its way better than the cordless impact drivers. See my video review here
customer_reviews.author: Michael

product_meta.title: Impact Driver
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Ideal for deck builders, HVAC installers, plumbers, and electricians, the Makita Hex Drive Impact Driver Features an ergonomically designed handle for comfortable operation. With a maximum torque of 88.5 foot-pounds (1,062 in.lbs.), this tool packs enough power for heavy-duty use. A variable speed trigger (0 - 3,200 RPM) lets you match the tool speed to a wide variety of driving applications. A 2.8 AMP motor means high performance at up to 3,100 IPM, even on extended jobs. A reverse switch located near the trigger facilitates easy, one-handed operation. A lightweight cast aluminum gear housing stands up to the toughest jobsites, and a 1/4-inch hex bit shank makes changing bits easy and fast. 

 FEATURES


 * Maximum torque 88.5 ft.lbs. (1,062 in./lbs.) 
 * Variable speed trigger (0 - 3,200 RPM) for maximum control 
 * 2.8 AMP motor for high performance (3,100 IPM) 
 * Reverse switch, located near the trigger, ensures easy one-handed operation 
 * Lightweight cast aluminum gear housing for durability 
 * 1/4" hex bit shank for fast bit changes 
 * Ergonomically designed handle for comfortable operation 
 * Externally accessible brushes for easy inspection and replacement 
 * Compact length (9"); Lightweight (2.9 lbs.) 

 SPECIFICATIONS


 * Belt clip (324284-9) 
 * Tool case (824630-1) 
 * Bit Shank: 1/4" Hex 
 * Bolt Drive: 1/4" - 5/8" 
 * Impacts per Minute: 0 - 3,100 
 * No Load Speed: 0 - 3,200 RPM 
 * Max Torque: 88 ft.lbs. / 1,062 in.lbs. 
 * AMPS: (115V) 2.9 
 * Overall Length: 9" 
 * Net Weight: 2.9 lbs. 
 * Shipping Weight: 6.4 lbs.
feature_bullets: Variable speed trigger (0-3,200 RPM) for easy operation
2.3 AMP motor for high performance (0-3,100 IPM)
Reverse switch located near the trigger ensures easy one-handed operation
Impact-resistant aluminum housing for gear protection and durability
Dual ball bearings for longer tool life
1/4"" hex bit shank for fast bit changes
Compact design (9"" long) and lightweight (3.1 lbs.) for both vertical and horizontal applications
Rubberized pistol grip provides increased comfort on the job
Externally accessible brushes for easy greater serviceability
True variable speed (0-3,200 RPM) for controlled fastening.
Compact design and weighs only 2.9 lbs.
Externally accessible brushes for easy serviceability and dual ball bearings for longer tool life.
Rubberized pistol grip for more comfort, control and reduced operator fatigue.
